alert.note: Alert for Columbus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 4:39AM EDT until July 31 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN COLUMBUS COUNTY... At 439 AM EDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing in sections of Columbus County. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Whiteville, Tabor City, Chadbourn, Williams, Sidney, Southeastern Community College, Clarendon, Brunswick and Columbus Regional Healthcare System. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
